steps.title: Get any sized spray bottle.
steps.content: Get any sized spray bottle. Try to get a spray bottle that is made out of glass instead of plastic; essential oils can degrade plastic over time. Also, choose a blue or brown glass bottle to protect the oils from sunlight. [1] X Research source A note on the type of bottle: We used a clear bottle here so that you could see everything we’re adding to the perfume, but it’s actually best to use a dark bottle. Dark bottles will offer more UV protection and prevent harmful rays from messing with your concoction over time.

steps.title: Fill the bottle most of the way with water.
steps.content: Fill the bottle most of the way with water. Be sure to leave some room for your essential oils. [2] X Research source You can use filtered or distilled water, but do not use tap water. If you have an unsteady hand, consider using a funnel to help you pour the water into the bottle.

steps.title: Add some essential oils.
steps.content: Add some essential oils. Start with 40 to 45 drops for every 2 ounces (60 milliliters) of water. You can use all one scent, or you can experiment with different combinations. For example, lavender and grapefruit will give you a nice, refreshing scent. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Close the bottle and shake it.
steps.content: Close the bottle and shake it. Your body spray is now ready to use. Keep in mind that the oils and water will separate naturally over time, so you will need to shake the bottle each time before you use it.

steps.title: Get a 5 to 6-ounce (150 to 180-milliliter spray bottle.
steps.content: Get a 5 to 6-ounce (150 to 180-milliliter spray bottle. It would be best to use a glass bottle because it won't degrade over time. If you can't find one, then a good quality plastic bottle will do. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Place a funnel into the mouth of the bottle.
steps.content: Place a funnel into the mouth of the bottle. This will make pouring in the ingredients easier and reduce spills.

steps.title: Pour 3 teaspoons of argan oil into the bottle.
steps.content: Pour 3 teaspoons of argan oil into the bottle. [5] X Research source If you can't find any argan oil, or if you can't afford it, try jojoba oil instead. You can also use vegetable glycerin instead.

steps.title: Add 2 teaspoons of loose eyeshadow or cosmetic pigment powder.
steps.content: Add 2 teaspoons of loose eyeshadow or cosmetic pigment powder. [6] X Research source The powder likely will get caught in the funnel, which is fine. The next step will resolve this. Popular colors are white or bronze, but you can use any color you want. Avoid using glitter. Even the finest glitter may clog up your spray bottle.

steps.title: Pour 2 ounces (60 milliliters) of distilled water down the funnel.
steps.content: Pour 2 ounces (60 milliliters) of distilled water down the funnel. [7] X Research source This will help knock loose any eyeshadow/pigment powder that got caught in the mouth of the funnel. Make sure that you use distilled water and not tap water. If you can't find any, then you can use filtered water instead. Tap water contains too many minerals, which can affect your spray, as well as shorten its shelf life.

steps.title: Consider adding some fragrance.
steps.content: Consider adding some fragrance. If you still have room in your bottle, you can add fragrance with a few drops of essential oil. Essential oil is very strong, so you will only need about 20 to 25 drops.

steps.title: Close the bottle and shake it.
steps.content: Close the bottle and shake it. Your shimmering body spray is now ready to use. The ingredients will settle over time, so you have to shake it before each use.

steps.title: Get a 2 to 3-ounce (60 to 90-milliliter) spray bottle.
steps.content: Get a 2 to 3-ounce (60 to 90-milliliter) spray bottle. Try to get a glass spray bottle if you can, as essential oils have a tendency to degrade plastic bottles over time. If you can't find a glass spray bottle, use a high-quality plastic bottle instead.

steps.title: Stick a funnel down the mouth of the bottle.
steps.content: Stick a funnel down the mouth of the bottle. This will make pouring the ingredients into the bottle easier.

steps.title: Pour 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) of distilled water into the bottle.
steps.content: Pour 2 tablespoons (30 milliliters) of distilled water into the bottle. If you can't find any distilled water, use filtered water instead. Do not use tap water because it contains too many minerals. These minerals may affect your body spray. [8] X Research source For a twist, use 3 tablespoons (45 milliliters) of rose hydrosol instead of water. It will make your body spray smell like roses. It is lighter and gentler than essential oil, and has some toning properties as well. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Add 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) of vodka or witch hazel into the bottle.
steps.content: Add 1 tablespoon (15 milliliters) of vodka or witch hazel into the bottle. This will act as a preservative, and help your body spray last longer. It will also help act as a binder, and prevent the essential oils from separating from the water. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable glycerin, if desired.
steps.content: Add 1 tablespoon of vegetable glycerin, if desired. This will help act as a binder and thickener. It may also help make the scents last longer. [11] X Research source Glycerin also has some toning and moisturizing properties. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Add 15 to 20 drops of essential oil.
steps.content: Add 15 to 20 drops of essential oil. You can use all one scent, or a combination of scents, such as: grapefruit, lime, and lemon. [13] X Research source If you used rose hydrosol instead of water, you do not need to add any essential oils. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Close the bottle and shake it.
steps.content: Close the bottle and shake it. At this point, your body spray is ready to use. Keep in mind that the ingredients may still separate. If that happens, simply shake your body spray before you use it.
